alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 20 at 2:45AM PDT until October 21 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves 6 to 9 feet with local sets to 10 feet are expected today and early tonight. Surf is forecast to subside slowly tonight, lowering to 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet by late tonight. However, elevated surf will continue through Saturday. There will be a high risk of dangerous rip currents through Saturday. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 3 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will be highest on west and northwest facing beaches. Nuisance to locally minor coastal flooding is possible around the high tide early this afternoon. This concern is mainly for low-lying coastal areas such as beach parking lots and harbor walkways.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.
